alert.note: Alert for Northern Monterey Bay; San Fransisco Peninsula Coast; Santa Clara Valley Including San Jose; Santa Cruz Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 29 at 10:13AM PDT by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Santa Cruz, southeastern San Mateo and west central Santa Clara Counties through 1045 AM PDT... At 1012 AM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Boulder Creek, or 11 miles northwest of Santa Cruz, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... San Jose, Palo Alto, Santa Cruz, Cupertino, Campbell, Saratoga, Los Gatos, Los Altos, Scotts Valley, Los Altos Hills, Boulder Creek, Ben Lomond, Felton, Rancho Rinconada Cdp, Portola Valley, Monte Sereno, Loyola, Lexington Hills and Cambrian Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Northern Monterey Bay; San Fransisco Peninsula Coast; Santa Clara Valley Including San Jose; Santa Cruz Mountains
